Description: Fragment of a furnishing textile made in undyed linen plain weave with decoration in woollen loops (many missing but the figure of a stylised lion or fantastic animal can still be seen); the animal is in blue with the teeth and tongue in red and four arrows in the body are in yellow and red wool; under the animal's legs are two waves in yellow and red wool; lain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/20), weft-undyed linen (S/11), supplementary weft loops- yellow, red and blue wool (S); there is a line of loops (c.5mm long) every 5 picks; all edges are cut and ragged
Bibliographic references: Budge 1922 / British Museum. Guide to the fourth, fifth and sixth Egyptian rooms, and the Coptic room (p.227) (Table case H, no. 6)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
